{button}`Release Source <https://github.com/jupyter-book/jupyterlab-myst/releases/tag/v1.0.0>`

## jupyterlab-myst now uses mystjs

The 1.0.0 release has added support for dropdowns (#32), tabs, grids (#70), and many more standard MyST elements that are out-of-the-box supported in [mystjs](https://myst-tools.org/docs/mystjs).

The summary of this release is in #57, with previous development in https://github.com/executablebooks/jupyterlab-mystjs.

![jupyterlab-myst-frontmatter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/913249/218578862-8185a22f-ac12-4065-b83a-db0dbabec27d.gif)
